page.title: 02TEVIOTDALE LEISURE CENTRE.
page.content: The Leisure Centre was opened in 1982 and provides the Borders with it's largest recreational amenity situated on the site formerly occupied by the railway station on the now defunct Carlisle-Edinburgh known as the Waverely line. The Centre attracts 2500-3000 people every week who can engage in swimming, squash, bowling, sauna including sunbeds, and table tennis. Meals and snacks are provided in the licensed bar and cafeteria. The pool is a free form deck-level leisure pool with a small paddling area and an attractive palm tree. The Centre is also available for hire and social events such as a Caribbean Evening have been a great success.
